intro: Benstonea nana, commonly known as the dwarf benstonea, is a small herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many aquatic and semi-aquatic plants. The plant features a short, stocky rhizome with several narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically bright green. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in a spadix, typical of the arum family. Benstonea nana is often found in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
